channel.title: [Webclient] Webclient IP and Port messes up
channel.description:
Well I got the webclient working up to the part where it shows Username, Password, IP and port. I already edited the files so it has my IP and port but for some reason on the webclient it shows 127.0.0.1 as the IP and null as the port. Help!?
Extra: I have a downloadable client. It has my IP and port which means there is something wrong with the webclient thing. I am using the tutorial by Ric.
EDIT: I found out the my .bat reads the EGUI. How can I change it?
It says this about the EGUI.
[code] java -Xmx500m -cp .;./bin; EGUI [/code]

item.title: [Webclient] Webclient IP and Port messes up
item.dc:creator: @jackboy89 jackboy89
item.description:
@jackboy89 wrote:

[quote=“Gl Then Gf, post:2, topic:331685”]done www.no-ip.com to get your no-ip??

done your portforward?? if so, is it open??[/quote]

This is done on a dedicated server. Yes I put it as no-ip. It works on my downloadable version of the client. When I try the webclient one, it shows 127.0.0.1 and null. I NEVER changed any of that. I only changed the Ric told me to in the tutorial and it didn’t include any IP/port editing.

I need to know how I can get it so when I load up the client, it reads the EGUI.class from the bin folder in the .jar.

Read full topic
item.source: [Webclient] Webclient IP and Port messes up
